com.inmobi.monetization
Class IMBanner

java.lang.Object
  android.view.View
      android.view.ViewGroup
          android.widget.RelativeLayout
              com.inmobi.monetization.IMBanner
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent
public final class IMBanner
extends android.widget.RelativeLayout

Class to get banner ads in your application by creating IMBanner instance and loading.

Deprecated. This slot will be removed in a future release. Use INMOBI_AD_UNIT_320X50 instead.

Constructor Detail

IMBanner

public IMBanner(android.app.Activity activity,
                String appId,
                int adSize)
Create IMBanner instance.
Example new IMBanner(getActivity(),"YOUR-SITE-ID", IMBanner.INMOBI_AD_UNIT_320X50);

Parameters:
activity -
appId - InMobi appId for the banner
adSize - - takes instance of AdSize, with value as one of the INMOBI_AD_UNIT_ constant values

Method Detail

loadBanner

public void loadBanner()
Load a new ad into the IMBanner. Ad will not be loaded if the previous ad is currently being loaded or if the User Click event is being processed.

stopLoading

public void stopLoading()
Cancel the ad request.

public void disableHardwareAcceleration()
Calling this method will disable hardware acceleration on the underlying views. Once disabled, it cannot be enabled.

public void destroy()
Deprecated. 

This method is deprecated. Calling this method will not have any effect.

setAdSize

public void setAdSize(int adSize)
Set adSize parameter. Choose between IMBanner.INMOBI_AD_UNIT_ constants as adSize
Example-
setAdSize(IMBanner.INMOBI_AD_UNIT_320X50)

Parameters:
adSize -

setSlotId

public void setSlotId(long slotId)
Set slotId for mediation/actions users

Parameters:
slotId - set -1 to switch to remove slotId

setAppId

public void setAppId(String appId)
Set app id for the IMBanner instance. Call this method if more than one appId is present in your app. If mediation is being used, calling this method will result in a no-operation.

Parameters:
appId -

setRefreshInterval

public void setRefreshInterval(int refreshInterval)
Starts or stops the auto refresh of ads. The refresh interval is measured between the completion(success or failure) of the previous ad request and start of the next ad request.By default, the refresh interval is set to 60 seconds. Setting a new valid refresh interval value will start the auto refresh of ads if it is not already started. Use IMBanner.REFRESH_INTERVAL_OFF as the parameter to switch off auto refresh. Use IMBanner.REFRESH_INTERVAL_MINIMUM as the parameter to refresh at the shortest interval. When auto refresh is turned off, use the loadBanner() method to manually load new ads. The SDK will not refresh ads if the screen is in the background or if the phone is locked.

Parameters:
refreshInterval - The refreshInterval value in seconds, which cannot be less than 20 seconds.

setKeywords

public void setKeywords(String keywords)
Set the keywords. Will be passed in the ad request

Parameters:
keywords -

setRequestParams

public void setRequestParams(Map<String,String> requestParams)
Set the request params. Will be passed in the ad request

Parameters:
requestParams -

setRefTagParam

@Deprecated
public void setRefTagParam(String key,
                                      String value)
Deprecated. 

This method is deprecated. Use setRequestParams to set the key value params to be sent in the adrequest
